folder: Columbus Circle and 59th Street, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
Celebrations Parades Municipal Events:

(1)
Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1932, No.7, at Columbus Circle, looking north. A dachshund balloon being drawn past the Columbus Monument.
November 24, 1932
P.L.Sperr

(2)
No.8. Another view of the dachshund.
November 24, 1932
P.L.Sperr

(3)
No.9. Felix the Cat, proceeding east on 59th Street at Columbus Circle.
November 24, 1932
P.L.Sperr
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade.

folder: 59th Street (West) and Columbus Circle  , Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1)
Thanksgiving Ragamuffins, 1933, No. 64: 59th Street at Columbus Circle. These ragamuffins really are colored. This block, from Columbus Circle to Ninth Avenue, is part of the "San Juan Hill" negro colony, in the west 60's around Amsterdam Avenue and west to the river.
November 30, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
No. 65. Staten Island, on the grounds of the U. S. Government Quarantine Station near Fort Wadsworth, on the east side of the Island. The church steeple is that of St. John's Protestant Episcopal Church, on Bay Street.
November 30, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
No. 66. The same trio, seated.
November 30, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Thanksgiving ragamuffins, No.64-66.

text:
8 Columbus Circle, adjoining the S.W. corner of West 59th Street. View shows building wall being prepared for a bill board space at $ 50.000 rental per annum.

About 1934.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - [59th Street (West).]

folder: Columbus Circle & [Central Park South.], Manhattan, NY
text:
Columbus Circle, Manhattan.
Corner of Central Park South.

General Photographic Co., Inc.
3293 Third Ave., NYC
title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - [Central Park South.]
